title: Drawing, "Male Head, Looking Downward"
description: The present square-shaped, heavy-jowled head is topped by curlicues of hair. Two furrows in the center of the forehead describe a frowning expression. The eyebrows rise sharply upward on both sides of the furrows. Closed eyes, and a thin line depicting the lips under an additional curlicue representing a moustache, exacerbate the disagreeable expression.  To the right are a capital A and, in script, an additional incomplete letter (S?)/ Ima(incomplete g).

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Male Head, Looking Downward".
10 x 9.3 cm (4 x 3 5/8 in.). Gift of Ellen Gustav Jensen. 1956-47-102.
